intro: Zerna tomentella, commonly known as the woolly zerna, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely hairy, or tomentose, foliage. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in alpine meadows. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
